articles.title: 2026 Team USA Trials, U.S. Amateur set to begin in Las Vegas
articles.content: The 2026 USBC Team USA Trials and U.S. National Amateur Bowling Championships are set to take place at the Gold Coast Bowling Center in Las Vegas from January 2 through January 7, 2026. More than 300 of the nation's top bowlers will compete for positions on Team USA and other national honors. Contestants must be at least 18 years old to be eligible for Team USA selection. After competition concludes, Team USA 2026 will be announced and will consist of at least 12 men and 12 women with the top four age-eligible men and women universally securing spots. The trials will test bowlers in various formats and set the stage for an elite roster representing the United States in international play. The U.S. Amateur Championship will run concurrently for bowlers looking to earn national amateur titles. The event not only highlights top talent but also features engaging competition formats to showcase skill and competitive spirit in the sport of bowling.

articles.title: PBA World Series of Bowling XVII Headlines 2026 PBA Tour on CBS
articles.content: The Professional Bowlers Association announced that the PBA World Series of Bowling XVII will take place from April 29 to May 12, 2026, in the greater Minneapolis area. This landmark event includes five PBA Tour title events and is set to be broadcast live on CBS and Paramount+ as part of CBS Sports' extensive 35 hours of 2026 PBA Tour coverage. Fans can expect to see intense competition among professional bowlers competing at the highest level. The PBA World Series of Bowling XVII is one of the most anticipated tournaments on the PBA Tour schedule, showcasing world-class talent and dramatic moments. The event continues CBS Sports' commitment to delivering premier bowling content to a national audience, providing both traditional and digital platform access for fans. Highlights of the 2026 season will feature top athletes, championship pursuits, and innovative coverage aimed at growing the sport's fan base.
